name: cement production, type ICo | hard coal ash | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/26597/documentation

The dataset describes the production of cement type ICo according to NTP 334.009 / ASTM C150 for Portland cements.;The cement density is 3g/ml and the resitance is 32MPa according to the NTP 334.090 standard (product description of cement ICo of Pacasmayo).;The weight composition of the cement is: 70% clinker, 4% gypsum and 26%limestone and 0.2% flyash.

This activity starts with the reception of raw materials.

This activity ends with the cement produced in the cement mill. The dataset includes packaging in cement bags.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The production volume of 2016 is considered. Data from sustainability reports of 2014 to 2017 is used.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Representative production of cement type ICo in Peru. Data based from main cement producers and personal comunications with local experts.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Represent the current technology for cement production in Peru.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The life cycle inventory model is based on the PCR for cement and concrete (Environdec, 2010), as well as on the LCA core model of the WBCSD-CSI EPD tool (Dauriat et al., 2014). Dauriat, A., Port√©, C., Delerce, C., Guignard, C., & Adams, A. (2014). WBCSD CSI tool for EPDs of concrete and cement: LCA core model and database report. Environdec. (2010). Product category rules of UN CPC 3744 Cement.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The data is compiled based on different data sources, including sustainability reports, literature values and expert judgements. Most data is derived from sustainability reports of two principal cement producers of Peru (Pacasmayo and UNACEM). The data is checked, completed and validated by local experts. In total, it is estimated that the data considered is representative for 67% of cement production in all the country (market share of the three main cement producers). Unit flows were calculated by dividing the amounts of inputs and outputs by the total clinker production in mass. The amount of the exchanges were calculated considering the arithmetic [weighted] average of the sample. No conversion to the geometric mean of the lognormal distribution was done, for consistency reasons with other Ecoinvent datasets.

exchanges.description: Calculated Value. In Colombia, according to ASOCRETO, the most common additions are crushed limestone, slags and fly ashes. An equal repartition by mass of principal supplementary cementitious material used in Colombia.The mathematical relation used to calculate the value is: -(1-clinker-gypsum-lime)
